subject: Re: [junit] What happened to getName()?
msgSnippet: On Mon, May 11, 2009 at 10:29 AM, Bradley, Todd ... There were a lot of good uses of getName(), like yours.  And some bad ones, of course.  I think Mark s
messageBody:
On Mon, May 11, 2009 at 10:29 AM, Bradley, Todd
<todd.bradley@...> wrote:
>> > The
>> > tradeoff was that if we dropped getName(), programmers
>> would be free
>> > to subclass from anything for their test classes. I haven't
>> > subsequently used this freedom to any good effect, but it
>> seemed like
>> > a good idea at the time.
>>
>> Does anyone have an example where this has been used to good effect?
>
> We used it for a couple things.  One was this: because we have a
> functional test framework built on top of JUnit, we optionally store
> pass/fail results in a database.  getName() was a very convenient way to
> get a descriptive name of the test to insert into the results table.

There were a lot of good uses of getName(), like yours. And some bad
ones, of course. I think Mark's question was whether the freedom from
a required base class has been used to good effect.
